name: (2Z)-2-(1,3-Benzodioxol-5-ylmethylene)-6,7-dihydro-5H-[1,3]thiazolo[3,2-a]pyrimidin-3(2H)-one
Reason: 1,3-Benzodioxole has a melting point of around 100 degrees Celsius. The methylene bridge (O=C1C(SC2=NCCCN12)=Cc4ccc3OCOc3c4) adds rigidity and might contribute around +20 due to the increase in molecular weight and van der Waals interactions. The thiadiazole ring introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions and potentially hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by about +70°C. The ketone group introduces polar carbonyl interactions, contributing approximately +40°C. The methyl group reduces the melting point by approximately -10°C due to the reduction in molecular weight and the absence of a hydroxyl group.
